qas.question: The USB Power Delivery revision 2.0 specification has been released as part of what?
What does the USB Power Delivery revision 2.0 specification cover?

answers.text: Type-C cable and connector with four power/ground pairs and a separate configuration channel

qas.question: Power delivery protocols have been updated to facilitate what?

context: The USB Power Delivery revision 2.0 specification has been released as part of the <a0_0>USB 3.1<a0_0/> suite. It covers the <a1_0>Type-C cable and connector with four power/ground pairs and a separate configuration channel<a1_0/>, which now hosts a DC coupled low-frequency BMC-coded data channel that reduces the possibilities for RF interference. Power Delivery protocols have been updated to facilitate <a2_0>Type-C features<a2_0/> such as cable ID function, Alternate Mode negotiation, increased VBUS currents, and VCONN-powered accessories.
